workflow.name: Automate blog & LinkedIn content creation with OpenAI & Replicate AI images
workflow.description:
# AI Blog & LinkedIn Content Publisher
## How it works

Daily trigger scans your Notion database for unpublished blog ideas
AI generates complete **blog posts** + engaging **LinkedIn content** using **OpenAI** (*Blog Posting is not implemented yet*)
Creates custom images for posts using **Replicate's Flux-Schnell** AI model
Auto-publishes to LinkedIn with image OR emails draft for review
Updates Notion with published content and tracks status

## Set up steps
**Connect accounts:** Notion, OpenAI, Replicate, LinkedIn, Gmail
**Create 2 Notion databases:** Ideas (input) and Articles (output)
**Update config node:** Add your database IDs and email
**Test with one idea:** Run manually first to verify everything works
**Enable daily automation:** Turn on the cron trigger

**Perfect for:** Content creators, developers, and marketers who want to transform rough ideas into professional blog posts and LinkedIn content automatically.

parameters.jsCode:
// Emit a single item with the eligible count for IF routing
return [{ json: { eligible_count: items.length } }];

parameters.message: =No rows found in {{ $('Set (Configs)').item.json.NOTION_DB_ID }} with published != true at {{$now}}.

LinkedIn Post Published!

values.content:
=You are a senior technical writer and LinkedIn ghostwriter for a Nepal-based DevOps/CloudOps/SysOps/Python developer who also loves AI/ML. 
Your job is to take one Notion row and turn it into:

1) A polished, human-readable blog article for Hashnode (Markdown only).
2) A LinkedIn post that feels authentic, insightful, and share-worthy, and most-importantly simpler english.

Your voice should feel like a real engineer sharing something useful:
- Informative but conversational
- Confident but humble
- Sometimes witty, but never forced
- Includes actionable value (tips, insights, commands, lessons)
- Occasionally adds light Nepali flavor naturally if language="ne"

---
### INPUT
- title: {{ $json.title }}
- angle: {{ $json.angle }}
- tags: {{ $json.tags }}
- primary_link: {{ $json.primary_link }}
- reference_links: {{ $json.reference_links }}
- images: {{ $json.images }}
- notes: {{ $json.notes }}
- target_audience: {{ $json.target_audience }}
- canonical_url: {{ $json.canonical_url }}
- language: {{ $json.language }}
- slug: {{ $json.slug }}

---
### PREFERENCES
- LinkedIn posts ‚â§ 1200 characters
- Blog word count:
  - Rich notes/tags: 900‚Äì1400 words
  - Sparse notes/tags: 600‚Äì900 words
- Include at least one specific example, command, or actionable tip
- Only one link allowed in LinkedIn text (if primary_link exists)

---
### STYLE TARGETS
For LinkedIn, pick the most natural style automatically:
- **Story:** Small anecdote or lesson
- **Industry Take:** Commentary with reflection
- **Tech Breakdown:** Clear step-by-step with code/tips
- **Basics:** Foundational guidance in checklist format
- **Humor List:** Funny but relatable "few techs" overwhelm joke
- **Optimization/Win:** Real-world result or improvement shared

---
### BLOG REQUIREMENTS
- Markdown only, no frontmatter
- Structure:
  - Hook intro (2‚Äì4 lines)
  - Clear sections with H2/H3
  - Include steps, code snippets, or bullet lists
  - Add ‚ÄúSharp edges & gotchas‚Äù with realistic pitfalls
  - Include a mini case/example
  - End with actionable ‚ÄúKey Takeaways‚Äù (3‚Äì6 bullets)
- Include:
  - SEO: slug, excerpt, keywords (5‚Äì10)
  - Suggested cover caption
  - Alt text suggestions for images
  - Canonical URL if provided

---
### LINKEDIN REQUIREMENTS
- Start with a strong HOOK (1‚Äì2 lines), do not mention word itself like 'hook' or similar
- Use short, human paragraphs
- Include at least one actionable tip or fact
- Invite engagement with a closing question or CTA
- Add 5‚Äì10 hashtags, a mix of broad (#DevOps #Cloud) and niche (#AWS #Kubernetes #Observability)

---
### RULES
- Never invent unknown facts
- Prioritize clear, human language
- Favor real-world examples over generic advice
- Use emojis sparingly and purposefully (max 3)

---
### OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
  "blog": {
    "title": "string",
    "slug": "string",
    "excerpt": "string",
    "keywords": ["string", "..."],
    "canonical_url": "string|null",
    "suggested_cover_caption": "string",
    "image_alt_texts": ["string", "..."],
    "markdown": "string"
  },
  "linkedin": {
    "style_used": "story|industry_take|tech_breakdown|basics|humor_list|optimization",
    "final_text": "string",
    "alt_titles": ["string","string","string"]
  },
  "safety_flags": []
}

You generate a single, realistic text-to-image prompt for the Replicate model black-forest-labs/flux-schnell, based on details from a LinkedIn post.

RULES:
- Output only the prompt as plain text, no JSON, no commentary.
- Make the scene look photorealistic but clean and professional ‚Äî perfect for LinkedIn.
- Focus on key objects, actions, and environment described in the post (title, excerpt, alt, keywords).
- Include subtle realistic elements (lighting, depth, perspective, color) but keep the layout minimal and balanced.
- Never include any legible text, logos, watermarks, brand names, or faces.
- Use soft professional lighting, shallow depth of field, and natural tones.
- Keep it under ~900 characters.
- Default to a 16:9 aspect ratio.

parameters.content:
# INITIALIZATION & DATA COLLECTION
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

- Cron triggers daily at 7 PM
- Set configs (DB IDs, email, LinkedIn settings)
- Query Notion for unpublished ideas
- Filter & clean the data
- Count eligible posts

If no posts found ‚Üí Send "nothing to do" email

# CONTENT PROCESSING & AI GENERATION
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

- Process ideas one by one (batch size: 1)
- Normalize data for AI prompt
- OpenAI creates:
  - Full blog post (Markdown)
  - LinkedIn post with hashtags
  - SEO keywords & metadata
- Validate & parse AI output

Quality control ensures perfect formatting

# CONTENT STORAGE & PUBLISH DECISION
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

- Save AI content to Articles database
- Check LINKEDIN_PUBLISH setting

Two paths:
PUBLISH = TRUE ‚Üí Auto-publish flow
PUBLISH = FALSE ‚Üí Draft review flow

All content safely stored in Notion first

# PUBLISHING & COMPLETION
‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

AUTO-PUBLISH PATH:
- Generate image prompt ‚Üí Create image
- Post to LinkedIn with image
- Send success email
- Mark as "Published"

DRAFT PATH:
- Email draft for review
- Mark as "Draft"

Both paths ensure proper status tracking

user.name: Sagar Budhathoki
user.bio: A DevOps and AI Engineer with a passion for automation, infrastructure as code, building resilient systems, and exploring AI agents & MCP technologies.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
